Battery life: A smartphone with innovative features that rely on a lot of processing power or data connectivity may have a shorter battery life compared to standard smartphones. This can be inconvenient for users who rely on their phones throughout the day.
Compatibility issues: Innovative features may not work with older or less popular smartphones, limiting their appeal to a specific group of users.
Dependence on innovative features: Users may become too reliant on innovative features, making it difficult for them to switch to standard smartphones in the future.
High cost: Innovative smartphones may be more expensive than standard smartphones, making them less accessible to low-income consumers.
Impact on existing products: The development of innovative smartphones may impact the sales of existing smartphone models, potentially leading to job losses in the industry.
